text: Hii
hey! didn't expect to hear from you haha, what's up?
Me
I'm good everyday!
haha that's the energy, I like it. how was your day today?
Ummmmm
I'm from Thailand!!
You from Japan Right?
yeah! born and raised here. Thailand, that's cool - which part?
I'm live in Bangkok.
Thailand is in a very bad situation right now. Corruption is rampant and difficult to solve.
Which city are you in?
I'm in Tokyo. yeah I've been reading about the situation there, sounds really tough honestly. how does it affect your day-to-day?
Yesss, It's okay
I like Osaka more than Tokyo! hahaha
haha you've been to Osaka? yeah it's got a different vibe for sure, more laid back I think
I've never been, but my first plan if I go to Japan would be to go to Osaka. ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
oh you haven't been yet? haha I thought you had. yeah Osaka's got a good vibe, the food is probably the best part honestly. what's making you wanna go there first?
oh wait actually I'm in Osaka not Tokyo haha, I got confused earlier ðŸ˜… so yeah if you ever come here we should definitely hang out, I'll show you around

I just wanted to try traveling to Japan since I work with Japanese people every day. After doing some research, I found that Osaka would be suitable for my first trip to Japan because the people are relatively friendly and it's less chaotic than Tokyo.
But from what I've researched now, Osaka itself is also overflowing with tourists. ðŸ˜…

oh you work with Japanese people? that's interesting, what kind of work do you do? and yeah haha Osaka has tourists everywhere now but if you ever come I can show you some spots that aren't too crowded
I work as a receptionist in an apartment building where all the tenants are Japanese, so I'd like to visit their country someday.
I've been trying to read various information about traveling to Japan for the first time, and most Thai people recommend Osaka as the best place to go. ðŸ˜…

oh that's really cool actually, so you're already used to dealing with Japanese people haha. and yeah everyone says Osaka is the best first stop, I think you'd like it here. what made you wanna work with Japanese people specifically?
I work in an apartment building where all the tenants are Japanese. My Japanese clients were sent to Thailand by their companies.
I hope we'll have a chance to meet when I travel to Japan.

yeah that would be cool! when are you thinking of coming? and btw I'm curious - what made you interested in working with Japanese people in the first place, like was that intentional or just kind of happened?
